title: Riven's Lore Update...low-key champion reveal or just stupid?
body:
So previously, Riven's lore tied her into the world pretty much perfectly for her character and title. We had a reason for why she would be a champion, what happened to her for her exile, and several potential reasons for her to keep fighting on, but seek a new way in her exile (Singed, her Noxian ideals, Noxus itself).

So we get this new lore...and her background is pretty much the same, but she is no longer seemingly in command of her unit, Singed is no longer a part of it(as far as her betrayal is concerned) and we hear the name Emystan come up again (previously in the Blood of Noxus comic for Darius). Which if this is a way to hint a new champion coming out, neat, this part is fine either way, we have a change in lore, but it's interesting and something to wonder at. The issue is with the end parts.


> For Riven, memories of the time that followed come only in fragments, and nightmares. She bound her wounds. She mourned the dead. But, most of all, she came to hate the sword that saved her life. The words carved into its surface mocked her, reminding her of all she had lost. She would find a way to break it, severing her last tie to Noxus, before the dawn.
> But when the blade was finally shattered, still she found no peace.
> Stripped of the faith and conviction that had bolstered her entire life, Riven now wanders Ionia’s battle scarred landscape in self-imposed exile, seeking atonement from those who cannot forgive: the land, the dead, and herself.

She no longer has any reason to fight. She's not looking to change anything, no potential of looking for revenge, she just cut and ran.
She no longer fits her themes of redemption and a spirit that is broken, but not lost. This lore is fitting of a side story of a character that you will never see, not one who might grace the battlefield with aggression and purpose.




> {{champion:92}}  My spirit is not lost.

Well, apparently it is now. Good job Riot {{sticker:sg-ahri-1}}

replies.body: Singed IS the alchemist of Zaun mentioned in the lore, just saying.
I get that, it's more to the effect that he's not worth a direct note to her and previously she was in command if her unit, not just acting under orders. I'll try to clarify a bit. Thanks.

Where does it say that she was not in command of the warband?

Even leaders can be given orders from higher up...

Why should she be a leader anyway? She was recognized as a great talent, but her story is about how she's a soldier of noxus blindly following noxus until this monumental event in her life. If she's giving orders instead of taking them, I  think that undermines her own story. 

I dunno why people think a character cant be cool or strong unless they're like, THE HOKAGE or whatever. In the grand scheme of things, Riven isn't a main character of the  lore and she isnt very powerful relative to other league champions, but her story and its personal stakes and the setup she has with yasuo (another, lore wise, weak and unimportant character) is compelling in its own little niche of the universe.
did she or did she not kill Yasuos master that part is not clear for me at all

Thats the point
Its implied and implied only.
so there is a new champ with wind blade elements

Not currently,but they might release another champ who has the ability to create a wind cut eventually(they don't necessarily need a sword to create something like this).
Or heck they might even just introduce an NPC who has such an ability.

And even if they do,they might do it just to set up a false lead and then surprise us when it was Riven after all.

It doesn't explicitly say it, but we're given:

> _"Riven’s unit was assigned to escort another warband making its way through the embattled province of Navori. The warband’s leader, Emystan..."_

The old lore established Riven as the leader of a company, which certainly conveyed a sense of some scale, whereas now she's only referred to as leading a unit, a term which can't help but feel like only a handful on individuals. It doesn't exactly help matters that previously she was raised up on a pedestal as "poster child of the Noxian spirit," whereas now the wording gives no such grandiose scope to the honour she received and makes her come across as notable but not exceptional - smaller in scope and influence.

Perhaps it is an incorrect assumption, but I find it only natural to assume that Emystan is both an individual of more influence on account of her leading a warband rather than a unit and that she is the one with seniority given how Riven is left totally in the dark about Emystan's plans for the amphorae they transport. It made absolute sense in the old lore that Riven's company became bound to the Zaunites, and indeed played into the feeling of how inglorious the war had become for her, but the way it reads to me in her current bio is that she was a low-ranking officer of some repute assigned to someone higher up the chain in order to make up the numbers.

If the implication was supposed to be that Riven assumed command of their combined forces then I'm yet to see anyone who has mentioned drawing that conclusion from her new bio.

Yeah well even the Darius comic features the Hand of Noxus as subservient to Lord or Commander (dont recall which) Cyrus. So take that for what you will.

I will admit, we need more insight into Riven's psychology as well. Something more than a 3rd person biography can ever give us. Because at the moment, although no fault upon the bio itself, but Quilleta does the ashamed aspect that Riven has but much better.

Speaking of her company; will we ever get to know more about **_Fury Company_** ?

I made a post about it myself, it didn't really manage to gather any attention though.

I've said largely the same things (and more) before.

I think we have to approach this bio as Chapter One of Riven's new story, whereas before her League Judgement was already a fair way on from Ionia. What we're seeing here is Riven in the immediate aftermath of a critical incident in her life and presumably the stories to come will show something of how she pulls herself back together and finds new drive and purpose. Hopefully.

Thank you for saying this. I have been trying to construct my thoughts on this subject for days. They fucking ruined her lore. Her new lore makes no sense for her character.

Specifically in regards to why she still has her sword in the first place.

too add some back story here is her old lore in reference to her sword. 

>As the invasion continued, it became clear that Ionian society would not be reformed, merely eliminated. During one bitter engagement, Riven's unit became surrounded by Ionian forces. They called for support as the enemy closed in around them. What they received instead was a barrage of biochemical terror launched by Singed. Riven watched as around her Ionian and Noxian alike fell victim to an unspeakably gruesome fate. She managed to escape the bombardment, though she could not erase the memory.

>Counted dead by Noxus, she saw an opportunity to start anew. She shattered her sword, severing ties with the past, and wandered in self-imposed exile - on a quest to seek atonement and a way to save the pure Noxian vision in which she believed.

This would follow that she would in fact keep the sword. It represented to her the noxian vision which she believed in and she was continuing to fight for. She has a reason for existing - seeking atonement for the wrongs her country did and trying to save her beliefs. 

Now it seems like she is kind of a dead character.
riot's lore department is a bunch of freelancer tumblr fan fic writers. nothing they write should even be read. it's straight garbage
